item.description:
One of the world's most loved character actors, Alastair Sim, in a masterful portrayal of one of the world's best loved characters, Scrooge!
Free admission

Lets meet at 12:45 and take in the current exhibits before the movie starts. There is a tour led by a Center docent at 1:00 for the exhibit: Notes from the Archive: James Frazer Stirling, Architect and Teacher. Anyone coming for just the movie meet us in the lecture hall at 1:50.

A Christmas Carol (1951)
2:00pm
Directed by Brian Desmond Hurst (not rated, 86 minutes). In this adaptation of Charles Dickens classic, Ebenezer Scrooge is given a chance for redemption when ghosts haunt him on Christmas Eve.
Lecture Hall

Parking: Metered street parking and public garages near the museum offer additional spots.There is also indoor paid parking at the Chapel-York Garage on York Street.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet in the lobby at 12:45, will wear the Black and white Piano key scarf
item.name: A Christmas Carol - at Yale Center for British Arts
